item.title: I realy need help badly

item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

well first off i don’t like js so eh lol second if you do it in good old html ill show you how to do it just get a form on submit send it to redirect.php and then do what you want to there just ad this in
[php]

<?php header('Location: http://www.google.com/'); ?>

[/php]
were ever your page is

[edit]
or this should work :S

<script language="JavaScript">
<!--
var time = null
function move() {
window.location = 'http://www.yourdomain.com'
}
//-->
</script>

item.title: I realy need help badly
item.dc:creator: @Winter_Ice Winter Ice
item.description:
@Winter_Ice wrote:

<br />
<input id="ToS"  type="checkbox" name="ToS" value="ToS" onclick= "if (this.checked)
doit(); else undoit();" />
<label for="ToS">I have read the <a href="tos.html">ToS</a> and agree to them in order to continue.<hr><b>Forums Currently Disabled Due To Hosting Reasons</b><hr></label>
</p>
<script type="text/javascript">
function doit()
{
document.getElementById("submit").disabled=false; }
function undoit()
{
document.getElementById("submit").disabled=true; }
document.getElementById("ToS").checked=false;
</script>
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th scope="row"  valign="top"> </th>
<td><input id="submit" type="submit" name="submit" class="submit" "value="Enter Forums" DISABLED/></td>
</tr>

<?php

}

well i made this with some loads of tuts i was reading just taking bits of code from them and adding them together and this is what i got but theres a problem how to i make it redirect to my other page?
